item.title: Rye Bread (Roggenmischbrot 2:1)
item.description: The finished bread after a day of resting. (Attempt 1) One of things that I miss the most about living in Germany is the incredible variety of breads that just aren’t available in the United States. During Covid-19, I’ve been making weekly loaves of Jim Lahey’s No Knead bread, and thought my next bread should be one that I am unable to find in the United States. After doing a little hunting on the internet I stumbled across Pl√∂tzblog: an incredible bread baking site with many of the German bread recipes I missed with recipes to bake at home.

item.title: Auf dem Weg! High School German
item.description: A project that I have been stewing on for a long time is now being realized due to the passion of a dedicated group of High School teachers. To check out the project on Rebus Community here
